document.heading: Underground Facilities Protection Amendment Act of 2000

history.narrative: Law 13-114, the “Underground Facilities Protection Amendment Act of 2000,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-278, which was referred to the Committee on Public Works and the Environment. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on January 4, 2000, and February 1, 2000, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on February 18, 2000, it was assigned Act No. 13-267 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-114 became effective on May 23, 2000.
